text:
This has absolutely been my life the past two months, as I've been doing exactly this. It's not done, but I'm happy to share my work with fellow content peeps:
<https://doc.clickup.com/d/h/df5t4-3247/ca65b9704a0e4af|Guidant Style Guide>

The guide was built in ClickUp and is embedded directly into our intranet (hence the terrible URL). Much of the content and organization was inspired by Mailchimp (as linked above) and <https://contentdesign.intuit.com/|Intuit>.

Creating this guide has been a one-woman show, so I'd love feedback!

text: Just a plug that Intuit and Mailchimp are both built on Writer’s styleguide platform, which also has a Grammarly-plugin-style line editing app that puts your style/grammar preferences right in your writers’ drafts. We became Writer clients halfway through last year and have LOVED it so far

text: Awesome yeah I just came across this too from <@U02546A8D2B>: <https://the-abm-conversations-podcast.simplecast.com/episodes/how-to-do-content-distribution-the-right-way-ross-simmonds>

attachments.fallback: The ABM Conversations Podcast - for B2B marketing professionals: How to do content distribution the right way: Ross Simmonds | The ABM Conversations Podcast - for B2B marketing professionals
attachments.text: In this episode, Ross Simmonds, the founder and CEO of Foundation, joins us to discuss 'how to do content distribution the right way'. Through this episode, Ross throws light on: --> How should a SaaS startup with a small team of 2-3 marketers approach content creation and distribution? --> How to make content distribution a strategic play than just using it as a tactic --> Baking content distribution into the content creation process --> How to use permissionless co-marketing as a content distribution play? --> Should you work on intent-driven content for each buying stage (or) should we blur the lines across the funnel stages? --> How to repurpose content and distribute it in a useful manner (and not lazy work)? --> Distributing content in communities and social media without losing trust, and a lot more...
attachments.title: How to do content distribution the right way: Ross Simmonds | The ABM Conversations Podcast - for B2B marketing professionals
attachments.service_name: The ABM Conversations Podcast - for B2B marketing professionals

text: Hi, <@U01MW6DPU72>! I like to think of it like, "What would get the person reading this sponsored guest post to think 'Wow, I need to find out more about this?' " What could the post be that would create enough interest but act as a teaser that would encourage people to visit your site? I like your pain point idea. If the sponsored article gives the reader enough information to get them to see that your business could be a solution that pain point they have, then they'll want to find out more. Provide a clear CTA that drives action and lets the reader know what the payoff will be. Is there a natural landing page on your site where it would make sense to send this traffic, to supplement what they've read in the publication and also to encourage them to take further action once they're on your site?

elements.text: Hi,

! I like to think of it like, "What would get the person reading this sponsored guest post to think 'Wow, I need to find out more about this?' If the sponsored article gives the reader enough information to get them to see that your business could be a solution that pain point they have, then they'll want to find out more. Provide a clear CTA that drives action and lets the reader know what the payoff will be. text:
I've been working with this general flow for Butter:

• Start with one of our webinars/events
• Repurpose it into a blog (some are SEO-focused, some are thought leadership)
• Embed the best bite-sized tips/clips from the webinar in the blog
• Share the blog on social (and get the event host to share too)
• Share the highlight clips on social
• Share the best tips from the blog as standalone social posts

elements.text: I've been working with this general flow for Butter:
Start with one of our webinars/events
Repurpose it into a blog (some are SEO-focused, some are thought leadership)
Embed the best bite-sized tips/clips from the webinar in the blog
Share the blog on social (and get the event host to share too)
Share the highlight clips on social
Share the best tips from the blog as standalone social posts
